RE: Gilliland v McGregor
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Dear Matt:
I am in receipt of your email on August 30, 2024. First, I would suggest that the
reference to a Wednesday dinner was just that, a suggestion. The main idea was to
have at least one meal per week, and Sunday seems to be the more practical as there
is less possibility of conflict with other things on the agenda of A.K., Mr. McGregor, or
your client. Secondly, the reunification therapy must take into consideration A.K.’s
activities. Your client’s position, that no matter how much it interferes with her daily
schedule that reunification counseling must happen, is unreasonable. As I see it, as
important as said counseling might be, we must take other matters into consideration
when scheduling said counseling, including the activities of A.K, as well as the work
schedules in order to avoid creating more stress among all parties. And last, the
reunification therapy is due to the fact that your client physically abused A.K. That
abuse, alone, has created the problem. We were willing to use our insurance if
insurance would pay, but it will not. Therefore, the cost of the reunification therapy
should be paid by your client.
As referenced in an earlier letter, I will be more than happy to present our
proposed order, and you can do so from your position.
Sincerely,
TOM F. YOUNG, JR.
